tags.name: Localization keys
tags.description: Manipulates localization keys, their translations and metadata

tags.name: Big Meta
tags.description: Handles big meta (context) for translation keys. Tolgee automatically stores contextual data about keys to provide this information to Tolgee AI translator.

tags.name: Slack slack commands
tags.description: Processes Slack slash commands, enabling users to execute specific actions within Slack

tags.name: Import Settings
tags.description: These endpoints enable you to store default settings for import. These settings are only used in the UI of Tolgee platform. It's also the default for stateful importing via `/v2/projects/{projectId}/import/*` API endpoints. The settings are stored per user and per project.

tags.name: Languages
tags.description: Languages

tags.name: Content Delivery
tags.description: Endpoints for Content Delivery management

tags.name: Import
tags.description: These endpoints handle multi-step data import

tags.name: API keys

tags.name: Slack events
tags.description: Listens for Slack events, such as button clicks, and processes them

tags.name: User
tags.description: Manipulates currently authenticated user

tags.name: Invitations
tags.description: These endpoints manage inviting new users to projects or organizations

tags.name: Project Transferring
tags.description: These endpoints manage transferring projects to other organizations

tags.name: Tags

tags.name: Namespaces

tags.description:
**Only for self-hosted instances** 

Managees global Tolgee Platform instance data e.g., user accounts and organizations.

parameters.name: filterState
parameters.description:
Translation state in the format: languageTag,state. You can use this parameter multiple times.

When used with multiple states for same language it is applied with logical OR. 
 
When used with multiple languages, it is applied with logical AND.

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description:
Languages to be contained in response.
                
To add multiple languages, repeat this param (eg. ?languages=en&languages=de)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: String to search in key name or translation text

parameters.name: filterKeyName
parameters.description: Selects key with provided names. Use this param multiple times to fetch more keys.

parameters.name: filterKeyId
parameters.description: Selects key with provided ID. Use this param multiple times to fetch more keys.

parameters.name: filterUntranslatedAny
parameters.description: Selects only keys for which the translation is missing in any returned language. It only filters for translations included in returned languages.

parameters.name: filterTranslatedAny
parameters.description: Selects only keys, where translation is provided in any language

parameters.name: filterUntranslatedInLang
parameters.description: Selects only keys where the translation is missing for the specified language. The specified language must be included in the returned languages. Otherwise, this filter doesn't apply.

parameters.name: filterTranslatedInLang
parameters.description: Selects only keys, where translation is provided in specified language

parameters.name: filterHasScreenshot
parameters.description: Selects only keys with screenshots

parameters.name: filterHasNoScreenshot
parameters.description: Selects only keys without screenshots

parameters.name: filterNamespace
parameters.description:
Filter namespaces. 

To filter default namespace, set to empty string.

post.description: Pre-translate provided keys to provided languages by TM.
Translate provided keys to provided languages through primary MT provider.
Copy translation values from one language to other languages.
Clear translation values for provided keys in selected languages.
Unlike the /v2/projects/{projectId}/import endpoint, imports the data in single request by provided files and parameters. This is useful for automated importing via API or CLI.
Prepares provided files to import.

parameters.name: structureDelimiter
parameters.description: When importing files in structured formats (e.g., JSON, YAML), this field defines the delimiter which will be used in names of imported keys.

schema.description: When importing files in structured formats (e.g., JSON, YAML), this field defines the delimiter which will be used in names of imported keys.

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description:
Languages to be contained in export.
                
If null, all languages are exported

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format to export to

parameters.name: structureDelimiter
parameters.description:
Delimiter to structure file content. 

e.g. For key "home.header.title" would result in {"home": {"header": "title": {"Hello"}}} structure.

When null, resulting file won't be structured. Works only for generic structured formats (e.g. JSON, YAML), 
specific formats like `YAML_RUBY` don't honor this parameter.

parameters.name: filterKeyId
parameters.description: Filter key IDs to be contained in export

parameters.name: filterKeyIdNot
parameters.description: Filter key IDs not to be contained in export

parameters.name: filterTag
parameters.description:
Filter keys tagged by.

This filter works the same as `filterTagIn` but in this cases it accepts single tag only.

parameters.name: filterTagIn
parameters.description: Filter keys tagged by one of provided tags

parameters.name: filterTagNotIn
parameters.description: Filter keys not tagged by one of provided tags

parameters.name: filterKeyPrefix
parameters.description: Filter keys with prefix

parameters.name: filterState
parameters.description: Filter translations with state. By default, all states except untranslated is exported.

parameters.name: filterNamespace
parameters.description: Filter translations with namespace. By default, all namespaces everything are exported. To export default namespace, use empty string.

parameters.name: zip
parameters.description:
If false, it doesn't return zip of files, but it returns single file.
      
This is possible only when single language is exported. Otherwise it returns "400 - Bad Request" response.

parameters.name: messageFormat
parameters.description:
Message format to be used for export.
      
e.g. PHP_PO: Hello %s, ICU: Hello {name}. 

This property is honored only for generic formats like JSON or YAML. 
For specific formats like `YAML_RUBY` it's ignored.

parameters.name: fileStructureTemplate
parameters.description:
This is a template that defines the structure of the resulting .zip file content.

The template is a string that can contain the following placeholders: {namespace}, {languageTag}, 
{androidLanguageTag}, {snakeLanguageTag}, {extension}. 

For example, when exporting to JSON with the template `{namespace}/{languageTag}.{extension}`, 
the English translations of the `home` namespace will be stored in `home/en.json`.

The `{snakeLanguageTag}` placeholder is the same as `{languageTag}` but in snake case. (e.g., en_US).

The Android specific `{androidLanguageTag}` placeholder is the same as `{languageTag}` 
but in Android format. (e.g., en-rUS)

parameters.name: supportArrays
parameters.description:
If true, for structured formats (like JSON) arrays are supported. 

e.g. Key hello[0] will be exported as {"hello": ["..."]}

post.description: Exports data (post). Useful when exceeding allowed URL size.

get.description:
Returns information about the connection between Slack account and Tolgee account which user is performing. The flow is the following. 

1. User executes slash command in Slack and gets link with encrypted Slack user ID, workspace ID and the Channel ID (to send success response to)

2. User gets opens the link and the Tolgee Platform frontend and it uses this endpoint to get the data info about the future connection

parameters.description: The encrypted data

warnOnDataLoss.description: If true, it will fail with 400 (with code plural_forms_data_loss) if plural is disabled and there are plural forms, which would be lost by the action. You can get rid of this warning by setting this value to false.

contentStorageId.description: Id of custom storage to use for content delivery. If null, default server storage is used. Tolgee Cloud provides default Content Storage.

autoPublish.description: If true, data are published to the content delivery automatically after each change.

slug.description:
Tolgee uses a custom slug as a directory name for content storage and public content delivery URL. It is only applicable for custom storage. This field needs to be kept null for Tolgee Cloud content storage or global server storage on self-hosted instances.

Slag has to match following regular expression: `^[a-z0-9]+(?:-[a-z0-9]+)*$`.

If null is provided for update operation, slug will be assigned with generated value.

pruneBeforePublish.description:
Whether the data in the CDN should be pruned before publishing new data.

In some cases, you might want to keep the data in the storage and only replace the files created by following publish operation.

languages.description:
Languages to be contained in export.
                
If null, all languages are exported

items.description:
Languages to be contained in export.
                
If null, all languages are exported

structureDelimiter.description:
Delimiter to structure file content. 

e.g. For key "home.header.title" would result in {"home": {"header": "title": {"Hello"}}} structure.

When null, resulting file won't be structured. Works only for generic structured formats (e.g. JSON, YAML), 
specific formats like `YAML_RUBY` don't honor this parameter.

supportArrays.description:
If true, for structured formats (like JSON) arrays are supported. 

e.g. Key hello[0] will be exported as {"hello": ["..."]}

filterKeyId.description: Filter key IDs to be contained in export

items.description: Filter key IDs to be contained in export

filterKeyIdNot.description: Filter key IDs not to be contained in export

items.description: Filter key IDs not to be contained in export

filterTag.description:
Filter keys tagged by.

This filter works the same as `filterTagIn` but in this cases it accepts single tag only.

filterTagIn.description: Filter keys tagged by one of provided tags

items.description: Filter keys tagged by one of provided tags

filterTagNotIn.description: Filter keys not tagged by one of provided tags

items.description: Filter keys not tagged by one of provided tags

filterState.description: Filter translations with state. By default, all states except untranslated is exported.

items.description: Filter translations with state. By default, all states except untranslated is exported.

filterNamespace.description: Filter translations with namespace. By default, all namespaces everything are exported. To export default namespace, use empty string.

items.description: Filter translations with namespace. By default, all namespaces everything are exported. To export default namespace, use empty string.

messageFormat.description:
Message format to be used for export.
      
e.g. PHP_PO: Hello %s, ICU: Hello {name}. 

This property is honored only for generic formats like JSON or YAML. 
For specific formats like `YAML_RUBY` it's ignored.

fileStructureTemplate.description:
This is a template that defines the structure of the resulting .zip file content.

The template is a string that can contain the following placeholders: {namespace}, {languageTag}, 
{androidLanguageTag}, {snakeLanguageTag}, {extension}. 

For example, when exporting to JSON with the template `{namespace}/{languageTag}.{extension}`, 
the English translations of the `home` namespace will be stored in `home/en.json`.

The `{snakeLanguageTag}` placeholder is the same as `{languageTag}` but in snake case. (e.g., en_US).

The Android specific `{androidLanguageTag}` placeholder is the same as `{languageTag}` 
but in Android format. (e.g., en-rUS)

filterKeys.description: Include keys filtered by the provided key information

filterKeysNot.description: Exclude keys filtered by the provided key information

filterTag.description: Include keys filtered by the provided tag information. This filter supports wildcards. For example, `draft-*` will match all tags starting with `draft-`.

items.description: Include keys filtered by the provided tag information. This filter supports wildcards. For example, `draft-*` will match all tags starting with `draft-`.

filterTagNot.description: Exclude keys filtered by the provided tag information. This filter supports wildcards. For example, `draft-*` will match all tags starting with `draft-`.

items.description: Exclude keys filtered by the provided tag information. This filter supports wildcards. For example, `draft-*` will match all tags starting with `draft-`.

tagFiltered.description: Specified tags will be added to filtered keys

items.description: Specified tags will be added to filtered keys

untagFiltered.description: Specified tags will be removed from filtered keys. It supports wildcards. For example, `draft-*` will remove all tags starting with `draft-`.

items.description: Specified tags will be removed from filtered keys. It supports wildcards. For example, `draft-*` will remove all tags starting with `draft-`.

tagOther.description: Specified tags will be added to keys not filtered by any of the specified filters.

items.description: Specified tags will be added to keys not filtered by any of the specified filters.

untagOther.description: Specified tags will be removed from keys not filtered by any of the specified filters. It supports wildcards. For example, `draft-*` will remove all tags starting with `draft-`.

items.description: Specified tags will be removed from keys not filtered by any of the specified filters. It supports wildcards. For example, `draft-*` will remove all tags starting with `draft-`.

Determines, how conflict is resolved.

- KEEP: Translation is not changed
- OVERRIDE: Translation is overridden
- NEW: New translation is created
- FORCE_OVERRIDE: Translation is updated, created or kept.

progress.description: Total items, that have been processed so far

createdAt.description: The time when the job created

updatedAt.description: The time when the job was last updated (status change)

activityRevisionId.description: The activity revision id, that stores the activity details of the job

errorMessage.description: If the job failed, this is the error message

fileName.description: Name of the file to import. This is the name of the file provided in `files` request part or in uploaded archive.

namespace.description: Namespace to import the file to. If not provided, the key will be imported without namespace.

format.description:
Format of the file. If not provided, Tolgee will try to guess the format from the file name or file contents.

It is recommended to provide these values to prevent any issues with format detection.

languageTag.description:
The existing language tag in the Tolgee platform to which the imported language should be mapped.

When null, Tolgee will try to guess the language from the file contents or file name.

ImportFileMapping.description: Definition of mapping for each file to import.

importLanguage.description:
The language from the imported file.

For xliff files, this is the `source-language` or the `target-language` attribute value of `file` element.

platformLanguageTag.description: The tag of language existing in the Tolgee platform to which the imported language should be mapped.

LanguageMapping.description:
Maps the languages from imported files to languages existing in the Tolgee platform.

Use this field only when your files contain multiple languages (e.g., XLIFF files).

Otherwise, use the `languageTag` property of `fileMappings`.

Example: In xliff files, there are `source-language` and `target-language` attributes defined on `file` element. Using this field you can map source and target values to languages stored in the Tolgee Platform.

structureDelimiter.description: When importing files in structured formats (e.g., JSON, YAML), this field defines the delimiter which will be used in names of imported keys.

forceMode.description:
Whether to override existing translation data.

When set to `KEEP`, existing translations will be kept.

When set to `OVERRIDE`, existing translations will be overwrote.

When set to `NO_FORCE`, error will be thrown on conflict.

languageMappings.description:
Maps the languages from imported files to languages existing in the Tolgee platform.

Use this field only when your files contain multiple languages (e.g., XLIFF files).

Otherwise, use the `languageTag` property of `fileMappings`.

Example: In xliff files, there are `source-language` and `target-language` attributes defined on `file` element. Using this field you can map source and target values to languages stored in the Tolgee Platform.

overrideKeyDescriptions.description: If true, key descriptions will be overridden by the import

convertPlaceholdersToIcu.description: If true, placeholders from other formats will be converted to ICU when possible

createNewKeys.description: If false, only updates keys, skipping the creation of new keys

fileMappings.description: Definition of mapping for each file to import.

tagNewKeys.description: Keys created by this import will be tagged with these tags. It add tags only to new keys. The keys that already exist will not be tagged.

items.description: Keys created by this import will be tagged with these tags. It add tags only to new keys. The keys that already exist will not be tagged.

removeOtherKeys.description: If yes, keys from project that were not included in import will be deleted.

supportArrays.description:
If true, for structured formats (like JSON) arrays are supported. 

e.g. Key hello[0] will be exported as {"hello": ["..."]}

relatedKeysInOrder.description: Keys in the document used as a context for machine translation. Keys in the same order as they appear in the document. The order is important! We are using it for graph distance calculation.

keyId.description: Key Id to get results for. Use when key is stored already.

baseText.description: Text value of base translation. Useful, when base translation is not stored yet.

isPlural.description: Whether base text is plural. This value is ignored if baseText is null.

services.description: List of services to use. If null, then all enabled services are used.

items.description: List of services to use. If null, then all enabled services are used.

additionalProperties.description: String translations provided by enabled services. (deprecated, use `result` instead)

machineTranslations.description: String translations provided by enabled services. (deprecated, use `result` instead)

TOLGEE.output: This was translated by Tolgee Translator
TOLGEE.contextDescription: This is an example in swagger

baseBlank.description: If true, the base translation was empty and no translation was provided.

TOLGEE.output: This was translated by Tolgee Translator
TOLGEE.contextDescription: This is an example in swagger

expiresAt.description: Expiration date in epoch format (milliseconds). When null, token never expires.

description.description: Description of the project API key

expiresAt.description: Expiration date in epoch format (milliseconds). When null key never expires.

supportedLanguages.description:
BCP 47 tags of languages supported by the translation service. When null, all possible languages are supported. 

Please note that Tolgee tries to fall back to a higher subtag if the subtag is not supported.

E.g., if `pt-BR` is not supported. Tolgee fallbacks to `pt`.

items.description:
BCP 47 tags of languages supported by the translation service. When null, all possible languages are supported. 

Please note that Tolgee tries to fall back to a higher subtag if the subtag is not supported.

E.g., if `pt-BR` is not supported. Tolgee fallbacks to `pt`.

id.description: The id of namespace. Null for default namespace.

name.description: Name of namespace. Null if default.

id.description: The id of namespace. When null, namespace doesn't exist and will be created by import.

keyPluralArgName.description: The placeholder name for plural parameter

keyNamespaceId.description: The namespace id of the key

screenshotCount.description: Count of screenshots provided for the key

screenshots.description: Key screenshots. Not provided when API key hasn't screenshots.view scope permission.

contextPresent.description: There is a context available for this key

outdated.description: Whether base language translation was changed after this translation was updated

auto.description: Was translated using Translation Memory or Machine translation service?

mtProvider.description: Which machine translation service was used to auto translate this

fromTranslationMemory.description: Was translation memory used to translate this?

icuPlaceholders.description: Whether to disable ICU placeholder visualization in the editor and it's support.

creditBalance.description: Current balance of standard credits. Standard credits are refilled every month

includedMtCredits.description: How many credits are included in your current plan

creditBalanceRefilledAt.description: Date when credits were refilled. (In epoch format)

creditBalanceNextRefillAt.description: Date when credits will be refilled. (In epoch format)

currentPayAsYouGoMtCredits.description: Currently used credits over credits included in plan and extra credits

availablePayAsYouGoMtCredits.description: The maximum amount organization can spend on MT credit usage before they reach the spending limit

extraCreditBalance.description: Extra credits, which are neither refilled nor reset every month. These credits are used when there are no standard credits

translationSlotsLimit.description: How many translations can be stored within your organization

includedTranslationSlots.description: How many translation slots are included in current subscription plan. How many translation slots can organization use without additional costs

includedTranslations.description: How many translations are included in current subscription plan. How many translations can organization use without additional costs

currentTranslationSlots.description: How many translations slots are currently used by organization

currentTranslations.description: How many non-empty translations are currently stored by organization

translationsLimit.description: How many translations can be stored until reaching the limit. (For pay us you go, the top limit is the spending limit)

pdfReady.description: Whether pdf is ready to download. If not, wait around few minutes until it's generated.

permittedLanguageIds.description: Languages for which user has translate permission.

items.description: Languages for which user has translate permission.

projectId.description: The API key's project id or the one provided as query param

viewLanguageIds.description: List of languages user can view. If null, all languages view is permitted.

items.description: List of languages user can view. If null, all languages view is permitted.

translateLanguageIds.description: List of languages user can translate to. If null, all languages editing is permitted.

items.description: List of languages user can translate to. If null, all languages editing is permitted.

stateChangeLanguageIds.description: List of languages user can change state to. If null, changing state of all language values is permitted.

items.description: List of languages user can change state to. If null, changing state of all language values is permitted.

scopes.description: Granted scopes to the user. When user has type permissions, this field contains permission scopes of the type.

items.description: Granted scopes to the user. When user has type permissions, this field contains permission scopes of the type.

type.description: The user's permission type. This field is null if user has assigned granular permissions or if returning API key's permissions

items.description: IDs of keys to delete

SuperJwtToken.description: Super JWT token is required for sensitive operations when user has set 2FA. You can obtain super JWT token via `/v2/user/generate-super-token` endpoint. But be careful! Super JWT Token has super powers!

ApiKeyInQueryParam.description: It's not recommended to use API key in query param, since it can be stored in logs.
ApiKeyInQueryParam.name: ak
